question: A takes three times as long B and C together to do a job. B takes four times as long as A and C together to do the work. If all the three, working together can complete the job in 24 days, then the number of days, A alone will take to finish the job is :
explanation:
Let time taken by B and C = x days
∴ Time taken by A = 3x days
∴ Part of work done by A, B and C in 1 day
$latex = \\frac{1}{x}+\\frac{1}{3x} = \\frac{3+1}{3x} = \\frac{4}{3x}&s=1$
$latex \\therefore \\frac{4}{3x} = \\frac{1}{24}&s=1$
$latex => 3x = 4\\times 24&s=1$
$latex => x = \\frac{4\\times 24}{3} = 32\\ days&s=1$
∴ Time taken by A = 32 $latex \\times$ 3 = 96 days. 
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
